comment.author: 77345821@N06
comment._content: This is not a Farman F.50... but rather an F.40. The F.50, as seen on the previous pages, was a larger, twin-engine design "heavy" bomber with twin "tractor" engines of over 200 h.p. The F.40, seen here, had a 160 h.p. engine, either a Renault or Peugeot engine. This one appears to wear the two color chevron of the CRP which was involved in the Defense of Paris and is fitted with both a machine gun, as well as Le Prieur rockets to attack German Zeppelins or other intruders.
